p: The second coronavirus-related outbreak was the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS), which was caused by MERS-CoV. MERS appeared in April 2012 and was first identified in humans in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA). The contact with camels or camel products is considered to be the cause of human infection. MERS continued to emerge and reemerge. Between 2012 and December 2019, a total of 2465 laboratory-confirmed cases of MERS-CoV infection, including 850 deaths (34.4% mortality), were reported from 27 countries [ 12].
